Recipes.Ingredients:
Ingredients:
- 1 package (16 oz) Pillsbury™ Place & Bake™ refrigerated chocolate fudge brownies
- 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese, softened
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup chopped Oreo chocolate sandwich cookies (about 4 cookies)
Recipes.RecipeDescription:
1. Heat oven to 350°F. Line 8-inch square pan with foil, allowing foil to hang over sides of pan for easy removal after baking. Spray with cooking spray.
2. Press brownies evenly into bottom of pan. Bake 22 to 24 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center of brownies comes out almost clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes.
3. In medium bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar and egg with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth, scraping down side of bowl frequently. Pour cheesecake mixture onto brownie base. Sprinkle cookies on top of cheesecake mixture.
4. Bake 23 to 28 minutes or until center is set. Cool 30 minutes. Refrigerate about 3 hours or until well chilled. Remove bars from pan, and remove foil. To serve, cut into 4 rows by 4 rows. Bars are best served same day.

Recipes.Ingredients:
Ingredients:
- 1 roll (16 oz) Pillsbury™ refrigerated sugar cookies
- 2 tablespoons grated lemon peel and 2 tablespoons lemon juice from 2 lemons
- 12 oz white candy melts
- 1 tablespoon yellow candy sprinkles, if desired
Recipes.RecipeDescription:
STEPS:
1. Heat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease cookie sheet, or line with cooking parchment paper.
2. Break up 1 roll (16 oz) Pillsbury™ refrigerated sugar cookies into large bowl; add 2 tablespoons grated lemon peel and 2 tablespoons lemon juice from 2 lemons. Beat with electric mixer on medium speed until blended. Scoop cookie dough by large tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on cookie sheet.
3. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until edges begin to lightly brown. Cool 5 minutes; shape into balls. Refrigerate balls 10 to 15 minutes.
4. Melt 12 oz white candy melts as directed on package. Using fork, dip balls into candy melts, tapping excess off. Place balls on cooking parchment paper-lined cookie sheet; top all with 1 tablespoon yellow candy sprinkles, if desired. Let stand until coating hardens, and enjoy!

Recipes.Ingredients:
Ingredients:
- 2-1/2 cups butterscotch chips
- 1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
Recipes.RecipeDescription:
RECIPE:
1. Line 8-inch square (2-quart) glass baking dish with waxed paper or cooking parchment paper.
2. In 2-quart saucepan, heat 2 1/2 cups butterscotch chips and 1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated) over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until melted.
3. Remove from heat; stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt. Spread in baking dish; refrigerate about 4 hours or overnight. Cut into 8 rows by 8 rows for 64 (1-inch) squares.

Recipes.Ingredients:
Ingredients:
- 1 package (16 oz) Pillsbury™ Ready to Bake!™ refrigerated sugar cookies
- 1/3 cup unsweetened baking cocoa
- 1 tablspoon all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
Recipes.RecipeDescription:
RECIPE:
1. Heat oven to 350°F.
2. In large bowl, break up cookie dough. Add cocoa and flour; stir with spoon or hands until well blended.
3. Shape into 28 (1-inch) balls. Roll each ball in 1/4 cup of the powdered sugar (reserve remaining powdered sugar). Place balls 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
4. Bake 9 to 12 minutes or until tops are cracked and edges are set. Cool 2 minutes; remove from cookie sheet to cooling racks. Dip tops of each cookie in remaining 2 tablespoons powdered sugar. Cool completely, about 20 minutes.

Recipes.Ingredients:
Ingredients:
- 1 roll (16.5 oz) Pillsbury™ refrigerated sugar cookies
- 2 to 3 teaspoons lemon zest and 1/2 cup lemon juice (from 3 medium lemons)
- 4 eggs
 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1-1/2 cups powdered sugar
Recipes.RecipeDescription:
RECIPE:
1. Heat oven to 350°F.
2. Break up cookie dough in ungreased 9-inch square pan; press evenly in pan. Bake 15 minutes. Remove from oven to cooling rack; cool 10 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, in large bowl, beat lemon zest, lemon juice, eggs, flour and powdered sugar with whisk, until well mixed. Pour over partially baked cookie crust.
4. Bake 20 to 25 minutes longer or until set. Remove from oven to cooling rack. Cool completely, about 1 hour. Sprinkle with additional powdered sugar. For bars, cut into 4 rows by 3 rows. Store in refrigerator.

Recipes.Ingredients:
Ingredients:
- 1package (12 oz) dark chocolate baking chips
- 1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated)
- 1 tablespoon milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
Recipes.RecipeDescription:
RECIPE:
1. Line 8-inch square pan with foil; spray with cooking spray.
2. In large microwavable bowl, microwave baking chips, sweetened condensed milk and milk uncovered on High 2 to 3 minutes, stirring every minute, until smooth.
3. Stir in vanilla until well blended (mixture may be thick). Spread evenly in pan. Refrigerate at least 2 hours until firm. Cut into 6 rows by 6 rows. Store covered in refrigerator.

Recipes.Ingredients:
Ingredients:
- 1 package (16 oz) Pillsbury™ Ready to Bake!™ refrigerated sugar cookies (24 cookies)
- 12 oz cream cheese, softened
- 1-1/2 cups powdered sugar
- 1-1/2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 tablespoon multicolored candy sprinkles
Recipes.RecipeDescription:
RECIPE:
1. Heat oven to 350°F. Spray 24 mini muffin cups with cooking spray. Place 1 cookie dough round in each muffin cup. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until light golden brown.
2. Carefully press end of wooden spoon into center of each cookie cup to make 1-inch-wide indentation. Cool completely in pan, about 20 minutes.
3. In large bowl, beat cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth.
4. Carefully remove cookie cups from pan. Pipe or spoon cheesecake filling into center of each cup. Top with sprinkles. Store in refrigerator.

Recipes.Ingredients:
Ingredients:
- 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese, softened
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup coconut, if desired
- 1 roll (16.5 oz) Pillsbury™ refrigerated chocolate chip cookies
Recipes.RecipeDescription:
RECIPE:
1. Heat oven to 350°F. In small bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar and egg until smooth. Stir in coconut.
2. In ungreased, 9- or 8-inch square pan, break up half of cookie dough. With floured fingers, press dough evenly in bottom of pan to form crust. Spread cream cheese mixture over dough. Crumble and sprinkle remaining half of dough over cream cheese mixture.
3. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until golden brown and firm to the touch. Cool 30 minutes. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or until chilled. For bars, cut into 4 rows by 4 rows. Store in refrigerator.
